Requirement: The system must respond to all standard mobile app actions (VC storage, VP creation, DID generation) within less than 1 second under normal conditions.
Backend issuance and verification APIs must respond within 500 ms under normal conditions.
Backend system availability must meet or exceed 99% uptime.
All private keys must be generated and stored within hardware-backed secure storage (iOS Secure Enclave, Android Keystore StrongBox).
All communication between mobile app, backend, and external services must use TLS 1.3 or higher.
The platform must enforce Zero-Trust security principles by authenticating and authorizing every backend request.
DID and VC operations must comply with W3C specifications for decentralized identifiers and verifiable credentials.
Zero-Knowledge Proof workflows must ensure selective disclosure and prevent exposure of unnecessary user data.
The system must minimize data collection to comply with GDPR data minimization principles.
Authentication strength must align with NIST 800-63 identity assurance guidelines.
User credentials must never be backed up to QuantumZero servers.
Users must be able to export an encrypted backup of credentials to personal cloud providers.
Backend trust-registry and issuance metadata must be backed up daily with a retention period of 30 days.
Restore procedures must include cryptographic integrity verification through hashing.
System logs, metrics, and diagnostics must be accessible through an administrative dashboard.
System documentation must include user guides, admin manuals, and maintenance manuals.
Backend services must include health endpoints for uptime and availability monitoring.
The mobile application must support iOS 16+ and Android 13+ to ensure secure hardware availability.
Backend services must be deployable using containerized infrastructure (Docker/Kubernetes).
All system components must be modular, allowing future adoption of emerging decentralized wallet technologies.
The mobile application must support offline operation for VP generation when internet connectivity is unavailable.
DID resolution must support both remote queries and local caching.
API rate-limiting must be enforced to prevent denial-of-service indicators.
The system must support future identity standards and extensible DID methods.
